keyword: how many calories are in a mcdonalds large french fry
title: How Many Calories in a McDonald's Large French Fry?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a McDonald's large french fry serving, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and quick tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a McDonald's Large French Fry?
assumptions: Standard McDonald's large fries serving (approx. 154 g), cooked in vegetable oil blend, salted; values based on current U.S. menu data.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, recipe changes, portion size, and preparation; always check McDonald's app or packaging for latest info.

quick_answer.text: A McDonald's large fries serving contains about 510 calories and 66 g of carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: No added salt (reduce sodium, calories unchanged)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a McDonald's large french fry?
What are the carbs in McDonald's large fries?
faqs.a: About 66 g of carbohydrates, including 6 g of fiber.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a McDonald's large french fry serving?
faqs.a: Roughly 24 g total fat, with 4 g saturated.

faqs.q: Are McDonald's large fries high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 350 mg per serving due to added salt.

faqs.q: How do medium McDonald's fries compare in calories?
faqs.a: Medium fries have about 340 calories, less than the large's 510.
